DOC.brief_summary: This study compare safety effectiveness three popular weight loss plan . These plan compare USDA Dietary Guidelines .
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity single significant , nutrition-related health issue new millennium . Several “ medical expert ” design promoted weight loss diet dramatically differ one another USDA Dietary Guidelines . These diet gain surprisingly widespread persistent popularity among Americans despite lack evidence support claim . This clinical trial provide preliminary feasibility data full-scale study examine health outcome ( e.g. , benefit , risk , success ) three popular weight loss diet . The study investigate behavioral physiological factor influence adherence retention diet plan . Overweight woman randomly assign one four diet 1 year : Atkins ( extremely low carbohydrate ) , Zone ( low carbohydrate , high protein ) , Ornish ( low fat ) , USDA/Food Pyramid ( high carbohydrate/moderate-low fat ) . Behavioral physiological data collect . Participants attend study visit baseline , 8 week , 6 month , 1 year . At visit , measurement include include weight blood pressure measurement blood test . Participants ask complete ten questionnaire course study assess behavior appetite . Participants also undergo DEXA scan ass body composition .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Body mass index ( BMI ) 27 40 kg/m2 Weight stable last 2 month Not actively weight loss plan No plan move area next 2 year Willing accept random assignment Exclusion Criteria Pregnant breastfeeding Within 6 month give birth plan become pregnant next 2 year Diabetes ( type 1 2 ) history gestational diabetes Renal liver disease , active neoplasm , recent myocardial infarction Hyper hypothyroidism Lipid lower medication medication know affect weight/energy expenditure Excessive alcohol intake ( selfreported , > 3 drinks/day ) Postmenopausal , include surgical menopause Currently psychiatric care severely clinically depress ( > 17 Beck Inventory )
